Description: Fragment of rim of Attic, probably red-figured, pottery column-krater. On top of the rim, silhouette feline to left, its rear legs and tail remain; on the edge, ivy, the glaze mostly lost.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'Both red and black figure column kraters may have files of animals drawn in silhouette on top of the rim, but this silhouette decoraion is more common in red figure. For the style compare two fragments from Naukratis, Heidelberg J 65 (CVA Germany 31: pl. 166 figs. 1-2 and p. 50 fig. 28) and London 1886, 0401.1164 and 1165, which are by the same hand and possibly from the same vase, although by a different hand (and thus certainly from a different vase) from the fragment in Alexandria.'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 98 no. 334 pl. 72)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0975)
